title: France's Amundi to buy Pioneer from UniCredit for £2.9 billion
title_page: France's Amundi to buy Pioneer from UniCredit for £2.9 billion - Business Insider
text:
The Amundi company logo is seen at their headquarters in Paris Thomson Reuters PARIS (Reuters) - French fund management company Amundi is to buy asset manager Pioneer from Italian bank UniCredit for €3.55 billion (£2.9 billion, $3.75 billion), and will finance the deal with a debt and equity issue.
The deal is one of various disposals being pursued by newly-appointed UniCredit Chief Executive Jean-Pierre Mustier to boost capital levels at the Italian lender, slim it down and make it easier to manage.
Amundi, which is majority owned by French bank Credit Agricole , said the Pioneer deal would result in cost-savings and would boost Amundi's earnings.
